title: Forever chemicals PFAS won't be in office supplies from 3M - Inhabitat
summary: 3M has announced it will cease manufacturing PFAS chemicals, known as 'forever chemicals,' by 2025 due to their hazardous nature and health risks. This decision reflects growing regulatory pressures, as these chemicals have been linked to significant environmental and health issues. Alternatives to PFAS, such as biodegradable plastics and safer waterproofing chemicals, are being explored. The article highlights the need for safer substitutes and the precedent set by 3M's commitment to stop using these harmful substances.
